/-- Harder inclusion: at a point in `D f K`, the function `f` has a derivative, in `K`. -/
theorem D_subset_differentiable_set {K : Set F} (hK : IsComplete K) :
    D f K âŠ† { x | differentiable_within_at (exprâ„) f (Ici x) x âˆ§ deriv_within f (Ici x) x âˆˆ K } :=
  by
  have P : âˆ€ {n : â„•}, (0 : exprâ„) < (1 / 2) ^ n := pow_pos (by norm_num)
  intro x hx
  have :
    âˆ€ e : â„•,
      âˆƒ n : â„•,
        âˆ€ p q, n â‰¤ p â†’ n â‰¤ q â†’ âˆƒ L âˆˆ K, x âˆˆ A f L ((1 / 2) ^ p) ((1 / 2) ^ e) âˆ© A f L ((1 / 2) ^ q) ((1 / 2) ^ e) :=
    by
    intro e
    have := mem_Inter.1 hx e
    rcases mem_Union.1 this with âŸ¨n, hnâŸ©
    refine' âŸ¨n, fun p q hp hq => _âŸ©
    simp only [mem_Inter, ge_iff_le] at hn
    rcases mem_Union.1 (hn p hp q hq) with âŸ¨L, hLâŸ©
    exact âŸ¨L, mem_Union.1 hLâŸ©
  /- Recast the assumptions: for each `e`, there exist `n e` and linear maps `L e p q` in `K`
    such that, for `p, q â‰¥ n e`, then `f` is well approximated by `L e p q` at scale `2 ^ (-p)` and
    `2 ^ (-q)`, with an error `2 ^ (-e)`. -/
  choose! n L hn using this
  /- All the operators `L e p q` that show up are close to each other. To prove this, we argue
      that `L e p q` is close to `L e p r` (where `r` is large enough), as both approximate `f` at
      scale `2 ^(- p)`. And `L e p r` is close to `L e' p' r` as both approximate `f` at scale
      `2 ^ (- r)`. And `L e' p' r` is close to `L e' p' q'` as both approximate `f` at scale
      `2 ^ (- p')`. -/
  have M :
    âˆ€ e p q e' p' q',
      n e â‰¤ p â†’ n e â‰¤ q â†’ n e' â‰¤ p' â†’ n e' â‰¤ q' â†’ e â‰¤ e' â†’ Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e p q - L e' p' q') â‰¤ 12 * (1 / 2) ^ e :=
    by
    intro e p q e' p' q' hp hq hp' hq' he'
    let r := max (n e) (n e')
    have I : ((1 : exprâ„) / 2) ^ e' â‰¤ (1 / 2) ^ e := pow_le_pow_of_le_one (by norm_num) (by norm_num) he'
    have J1 : Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e p q - L e p r) â‰¤ 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e :=
      by
      have I1 : x âˆˆ A f (L e p q) ((1 / 2) ^ p) ((1 / 2) ^ e) := (hn e p q hp hq).2.1
      have I2 : x âˆˆ A f (L e p r) ((1 / 2) ^ p) ((1 / 2) ^ e) := (hn e p r hp (le_max_left _ _)).2.1
      exact norm_sub_le_of_mem_A P _ I1 I2
    have J2 : Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e p r - L e' p' r) â‰¤ 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e :=
      by
      have I1 : x âˆˆ A f (L e p r) ((1 / 2) ^ r) ((1 / 2) ^ e) := (hn e p r hp (le_max_left _ _)).2.2
      have I2 : x âˆˆ A f (L e' p' r) ((1 / 2) ^ r) ((1 / 2) ^ e') := (hn e' p' r hp' (le_max_right _ _)).2.2
      exact norm_sub_le_of_mem_A P _ I1 (A_mono _ _ I I2)
    have J3 : Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e' p' r - L e' p' q') â‰¤ 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e :=
      by
      have I1 : x âˆˆ A f (L e' p' r) ((1 / 2) ^ p') ((1 / 2) ^ e') := (hn e' p' r hp' (le_max_right _ _)).2.1
      have I2 : x âˆˆ A f (L e' p' q') ((1 / 2) ^ p') ((1 / 2) ^ e') := (hn e' p' q' hp' hq').2.1
      exact norm_sub_le_of_mem_A P _ (A_mono _ _ I I1) (A_mono _ _ I I2)
    calc
      Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e p q - L e' p' q') =
          Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e p q - L e p r + (L e p r - L e' p' r) + (L e' p' r - L e' p' q')) :=
        by
        congr 1
        abel
      _ â‰¤ Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e p q - L e p r) + Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e p r - L e' p' r) + Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e' p' r - L e' p' q') :=
        (le_trans (norm_add_le _ _) (add_le_add_right (norm_add_le _ _) _))
      _ â‰¤ 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e + 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e + 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e := by apply_rules [add_le_add]
      _ = 12 * (1 / 2) ^ e := by ring
      
  /- For definiteness, use `L0 e = L e (n e) (n e)`, to have a single sequence. We claim that this
    is a Cauchy sequence. -/
  let L0 : â„• â†’ F := fun e => L e (n e) (n e)
  have : CauchySeq L0 := by
    rw [Metric.cauchySeq_iff']
    intro Îµ Îµpos
    obtain âŸ¨e, heâŸ© : âˆƒ e : â„•, (1 / 2) ^ e < Îµ / 12 := exists_pow_lt_of_lt_one (div_pos Îµpos (by norm_num)) (by norm_num)
    refine' âŸ¨e, fun e' he' => _âŸ©
    rw [dist_comm, dist_eq_norm]
    calc
      Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L0 e - L0 e') â‰¤ 12 * (1 / 2) ^ e := M _ _ _ _ _ _ le_rfl le_rfl le_rfl le_rfl he'
      _ < 12 * (Îµ / 12) := (mul_lt_mul' le_rfl he (le_of_lt P) (by norm_num))
      _ = Îµ := by
        field_simp [(by norm_num : (12 : exprâ„) â‰  0)]
        ring
      
  -- As it is Cauchy, the sequence `L0` converges, to a limit `f'` in `K`.
  obtain âŸ¨f', f'K, hf'âŸ© : âˆƒ f' âˆˆ K, tendsto L0 at_top ((nhds) f') :=
    cauchySeq_tendsto_of_isComplete hK (fun e => (hn e (n e) (n e) le_rfl le_rfl).1) this
  have Lf' : âˆ€ e p, n e â‰¤ p â†’ Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (L e (n e) p - f') â‰¤ 12 * (1 / 2) ^ e :=
    by
    intro e p hp
    apply le_of_tendsto (tendsto_const_nhds.sub hf').norm
    rw [eventually_at_top]
    exact âŸ¨e, fun e' he' => M _ _ _ _ _ _ le_rfl hp le_rfl le_rfl he'âŸ©
  -- Let us show that `f` has right derivative `f'` at `x`.
  have : has_deriv_within_at f f' (Ici x) x :=
    by
    simp only [has_deriv_within_at_iff_is_o, is_o_iff]
    /- to get an approximation with a precision `Îµ`, we will replace `f` with `L e (n e) m` for
        some large enough `e` (yielding a small error by uniform approximation). As one can vary `m`,
        this makes it possible to cover all scales, and thus to obtain a good linear approximation in
        the whole interval of length `(1/2)^(n e)`. -/
    intro Îµ Îµpos
    obtain âŸ¨e, heâŸ© : âˆƒ e : â„•, (1 / 2) ^ e < Îµ / 16 := exists_pow_lt_of_lt_one (div_pos Îµpos (by norm_num)) (by norm_num)
    have xmem : x âˆˆ Ico x (x + (1 / 2) ^ (n e + 1)) := by
      simp only [one_div, left_mem_Ico, lt_add_iff_pos_right, inv_pos, pow_pos, zero_lt_bit0, zero_lt_one]
    filter_upwards [Icc_mem_nhdsWithin_Ici xmem]with y hy
    -- We need to show that `f y - f x - f' (y - x)` is small. For this, we will work at scale
    -- `k` where `k` is chosen with `â€–y - xâ€– âˆ¼ 2 ^ (-k)`.
    rcases eq_or_lt_of_le hy.1 with (rfl | xy)
    Â· simp only [sub_self, zero_smul, norm_zero, MulZeroClass.mul_zero]
    have yzero : 0 < y - x := sub_pos.2 xy
    have y_le : y - x â‰¤ (1 / 2) ^ (n e + 1) := by linarith [hy.2]
    have yone : y - x â‰¤ 1 := le_trans y_le (pow_le_one _ (by norm_num) (by norm_num))
    -- define the scale `k`.
    obtain âŸ¨k, hk, h'kâŸ© : âˆƒ k : â„•, (1 / 2) ^ (k + 1) < y - x âˆ§ y - x â‰¤ (1 / 2) ^ k :=
      exists_nat_pow_near_of_lt_one yzero yone (by norm_num : (0 : exprâ„) < 1 / 2) (by norm_num : (1 : exprâ„) / 2 < 1)
    -- the scale is large enough (as `y - x` is small enough)
    have k_gt : n e < k :=
      by
      have : ((1 : exprâ„) / 2) ^ (k + 1) < (1 / 2) ^ (n e + 1) := lt_of_lt_of_le hk y_le
      rw [pow_lt_pow_iff_of_lt_one (by norm_num : (0 : exprâ„) < 1 / 2) (by norm_num)] at this
      linarith
    set m := k - 1 with hl
    have m_ge : n e â‰¤ m := Nat.le_pred_of_lt k_gt
    have km : k = m + 1 := (nat.succ_pred_eq_of_pos (lt_of_le_of_lt (zero_le _) k_gt)).symm
    rw [km] at hk h'k
    -- `f` is well approximated by `L e (n e) k` at the relevant scale
    -- (in fact, we use `m = k - 1` instead of `k` because of the precise definition of `A`).
    have J : Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (f y - f x - Â«expr â€¢ Â» (y - x) (L e (n e) m)) â‰¤ 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (y - x) :=
      calc
        Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (f y - f x - Â«expr â€¢ Â» (y - x) (L e (n e) m)) â‰¤ (1 / 2) ^ e * (1 / 2) ^ m :=
          by
          apply le_of_mem_A (hn e (n e) m le_rfl m_ge).2.2
          Â· simp only [one_div, inv_pow, left_mem_Icc, le_add_iff_nonneg_right]
            exact div_nonneg (inv_nonneg.2 (pow_nonneg zero_le_two _)) zero_le_two
          Â· simp only [pow_add, tsub_le_iff_left] at h'k
            simpa only [hy.1, mem_Icc, true_and_iff, one_div, pow_one] using h'k
        _ = 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e * (1 / 2) ^ (m + 2) := by
          field_simp
          ring
        _ â‰¤ 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e * (y - x) :=
          (mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left (le_of_lt hk) (mul_nonneg (by norm_num) (le_of_lt P)))
        _ = 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (y - x) := by rw [Real.norm_of_nonneg yzero.le]
        
    calc
      Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (f y - f x - Â«expr â€¢ Â» (y - x) f') =
          Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (f y - f x - Â«expr â€¢ Â» (y - x) (L e (n e) m) + Â«expr â€¢ Â» (y - x) (L e (n e) m - f')) :=
        by simp only [smul_sub, sub_add_sub_cancel]
      _ â‰¤ 4 * (1 / 2) ^ e * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (y - x) + Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (y - x) * (12 * (1 / 2) ^ e) :=
        (norm_add_le_of_le J
          (by
            rw [norm_smul]

      _ â‰¤ 16 * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (y - x) * (Îµ / 16) :=
        (mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left he.le (mul_nonneg (by norm_num) (norm_nonneg _)))
      _ = Îµ * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (y - x) := by ring
      
  rw [â† this.deriv_within (unique_diff_on_Ici x x le_rfl)] at f'K
  exact âŸ¨this.differentiable_within_at, f'KâŸ©

theorem B_mem_nhds_within_Ioi {K : Set F} {r s Îµ x : exprâ„} (hx : x âˆˆ B f K r s Îµ) : B f K r s Îµ âˆˆ nhds_within.gt x :=

theorem A_mem_nhds_within_Ioi {L : F} {r Îµ x : exprâ„} (hx : x âˆˆ A f L r Îµ) : A f L r Îµ âˆˆ nhds_within.gt x :=
